conclusion: To determine the direction of motion of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds, we can analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph provided.
The v-t graph shows the velocity of the particle over time.
Positive velocity indicates motion in the positive direction.
Negative velocity indicates motion in the negative direction.
We are interested in the time interval from 2 to 3 seconds.
At t = 2 seconds, the velocity is 0 (crossing the time axis).
From 2 to 3 seconds, the velocity decreases and becomes negative.

premise: Since the velocity is negative from 2 to 3 seconds.
conclusion: The particle is moving in the opposite direction to the defined positive direction.
